node.title: Covid Measures and Misnomers
node.description: Readers discuss President Biden’s plan, the term “breakthrough infections” and long Covid. Also: Public education inequities; political donations.

node.title: New findings on risk of hospitalization with Omicron
node.description: "What is unclear is whether the picture will be similar in countries where there are high levels of vaccination but very low levels of previous infection," one of the study's authors says.

node.title: P&G shampoo recall only the latest for benzene in spray products
node.description: More than half a dozen recalls have been issued this year as carcinogen is also found in sunscreens, foot deodorants.

node.title: Medicinal cannabis company fined, must offer refunds to investors after making false claims
node.description: The Financial Markets Authority (FMA) has penalised the medicinal cannabis company Medical Kiwi $250,000 and ordered it to offer a refund to investors, after it admitted to making false claims during…

node.title: Mixed year for KiwiSaver investments reflects flat NZ share market - analysts
node.description: It has not been the best year for KiwiSaver investors, but not too bad considering the market volatility driven by the highs and lows of the pandemic.

node.title: Man dead after motorcycle collided with freight train
node.description: The man was on a farm track that intersects with a private level crossing when the collision happened just after 5.30pm today near Otaio.

node.title: Supply chain shortage, Omicron not stopping holiday shoppers
node.description: A nationwide supply chain shortage has left orders that were supposed to be delivered to stores on cargo ships.

node.title: Natalie Wood
node.description: A look at the actress' career, from child star to her untimely and mysterious death

node.title: CDC director: Update on COVID isolation guideline may come "soon"
node.description: According to the CDC guidelines, those who test positive, regardless of vaccination status, must isolate for 10 days.

node.title: The hunt for Forrest Fenn's treasure
node.description: Forrest Fenn hid a treasure somewhere in the Rocky Mountains. Five men died searching for it.

node.title: Another Surge in the Virus Has Colleges Fearing a Mental Health Crisis
node.description: After almost two years of remote schooling, restricted gatherings and constant testing, many students are isolated and depressed. Omicron may make things worse.

node.title: Sonic booms from fighter jets rattle residents in Illinois and Oregon
node.description: A loud boom and shaking were felt my many residents, with some fearing an earthquake had struck.

node.title: ICE to test body cameras for special agents in pilot program
node.description: The footage will be subject to Freedom of Information Act requests and available to defense lawyers in criminal cases during the discovery process.

node.title: Move over, Black Friday. Big discounts are coming in January.
node.description: One expert expects "heroic" discounts on goods in January. But it's hard to predict what items will be on sale.

node.title: Biden to get another COVID-19 test after close contact with infected staffer
node.description: White House press secretary Jen Psaki said the president received a negative PCR test Monday.

node.title: What It’s Like to Live Next to America’s Largest Port Amid a Global Supply Chain Crisis
node.description: In one Los Angeles neighborhood, traffic spilling over from the backlogged port has brought noise, pollution and safety hazards.

node.title: Governor urged to shorten man's 110-year sentence as millions sign petition
node.description: A Colorado judge sentenced Rogel Aguilera-Mederos after a jury found him guilty on four counts of vehicular homicide and 23 other charges related to a 2019 accident.

node.title: A U.S. regulator is investigating Tesla over a video game feature.
node.description: Drivers can be distracted playing games while the vehicle is in motion, the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said, following a New York Times report earlier this month.

node.title: Biden unveils Omicron plan, including 500 million at-home COVID tests
node.description: The president announced a plan to make 500 million free at-home tests available to Americans who request them.

node.title: Army veteran falls to his death trying to climb Mount Whitney
node.description: Searchers using an avalanche probe found Eric Goepfert's body "under deep snow" at the base of the Ebersbacher Ledges.

node.title: Sally Ann Howes, Star of ‘Chitty Chitty Bang Bang,’ Dies at 91
node.description: The English-born actress captivated children in the 1968 film, which became a holiday favorite. It was one of around 140 productions she appeared in during a six-decade career.

node.title: Hawaii families devastated by impacts of Navy's fuel-contaminated water
node.description: Thousands of families could be displaced for up to six to eight weeks.

node.title: Harvard professor found guilty of lying about ties to China
node.description: Charles Lieber allegedly concealed his income from the Chinese program, including $50,000 a month from the Wuhan University of Technology.

node.title: Gold ring with Jesus symbol among treasure found in ancient shipwreck
node.description: The Roman-era ring was found among a trove of third-century Roman coins and a bronze eagle figurine, researchers said.

node.title: Child dies at public swimming pool in Christchurch
node.description: A police spokesperson says emergency services were notified at 2.45pm today that the child was found at Waltham Swimming Pool.

node.title: Search underway for swimmer missing in Canterbury's Waimakariri river
node.description: A police spokesperson says emergency services were called shortly after 7pm after a person jumped into the river but did not resurface.

node.title: AstraZeneca, Oxford aim to produce Omicron-targeted vaccine
node.description: AstraZeneca Plc said it is working with Oxford University to produce a vaccine for the Omicron coronavirus variant, joining other vaccine-makers who are looking to develop the variant-specific…

node.title: COVID-19 modeller warns even red traffic light wouldn't stop spread of Omicron in New Zealand
node.description: Cases are skyrocketing in NSW - and an expert warns it's likely to spread here at a similar speed.

node.title: N.H.L. players will skip the 2022 Beijing Olympics.
node.description: By Alan Blinder and Andrew Das

node.title: Focus on Politics: An end-of-year chat with the minor party leaders
node.description: Podcast - With ACT soaking up support, the Greens forging their own path, and Te Pāti Māori rebuilding its identity, RNZ's political team sat down with the leaders to discuss 2021. Audio
